intro: Uleanthus, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. Uleanthus has palmate leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
